doc.after: In August 1836, two real estate entrepreneursâAugustus Chapman Allen and John Kirby Allenâfrom NewÂ York, purchased 6,642 acres (26.88Â km2) of land along Buffalo Bayou with the intent of founding a city.[15] The Allen brothers decided to name the city after Sam Houston, the popular general at the Battle of San Jacinto,[15] who was elected President of Texas in September 1836.
